   8411  f457				   mouse0update
   8412  f457				  -	      ifconst	MOUSE0SUPPORT
   8413  f457				  -
   8414  f457				  -mousetableselect =	inttemp2
   8415  f457				  -mousexdelta =	inttemp3
   8416  f457				  -mouseydelta =	inttemp4
   8417  f457				  -lastSWCHA  =	inttemp6
   8418  f457				  -
   8419  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   8420  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   8421  f457				  -
   8422  f457				  -	      lda	#$ff
   8423  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   8424  f457				  -
   8425  f457				  -	      ldy	port0control
   8426  f457				  -
   8427  f457				  -	      lda	#%00010000
   8428  f457				  -	      cpy	#9	; AMIGA?
   8429  f457				  -	      bne	skipamigabitsfix0
   8430  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8431  f457				  -skipamigabitsfix0
   8432  f457				  -	      sta	mousetableselect
   8433  f457				  -	      ifconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   8434  f457				  -	      cpy	#6	; DRIVING?
   8435  f457				  -	      bne	skipdriving0setup
   8436  f457				  -			; swap mousex0 and mousey0. mousex seen by the 7800basic program
   8437  f457				  -			; trails the actual mousex0, so we can smoothly interpolate toward
   8438  f457				  -			; the actual position. This actual position is stored in mousey0
   8439  f457				  -			; after the driver has run.
   8440  f457				  -	      ldx	mousex0
   8441  f457				  -	      lda	mousey0
   8442  f457				  -	      stx	mousey0
   8443  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8444  f457				  -skipdriving0setup
   8445  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   8446  f457				  -
   8447  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8448  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8449  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   8450  f457				  -
   8451  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSETIME
   8452  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8453  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   8454  f457				  -	      else
   8455  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   8456  f457				  -	      endif
   8457  f457				  -	      else
   8458  f457				  -	      lda	#MOUSETIME
   8459  f457				  -	      endif
   8460  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   8461  f457				  -
   8462  f457				  -mouse0updateloop
   8463  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8464  f457				  -	      asr	#%11110000	; Undocumented. A = A & #IMM, then LSR A.
   8465  f457				  -	      cmp	lastSWCHA
   8466  f457				  -	      beq	mouse0loopcondition
   8467  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   8468  f457				  -	      lsr
   8469  f457				  -	      lsr
   8470  f457				  -	      lsr
   8471  f457				  -
   8472  f457				  -	      ora	mousetableselect	; atari/amiga decoding table selection
   8473  f457				  -
   8474  f457				  -			; st mice encode on different bits/joystick-lines than amiga mice...
   8475  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   8476  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   8477  f457				  -			; ...so can shuffle the amiga bits to reuse the st driver.
   8478  f457				  -	      tay
   8479  f457				  -	      lax	amigatoataribits,y
   8480  f457				  -
   8481  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8482  f457				  -			; first the Y...
   8483  f457				  -	      and	#%00001100
   8484  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodey0
   8485  f457				  -	      tay
   8486  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   8487  f457				  -	      clc
   8488  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   8489  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   8490  f457				  -	      tya
   8491  f457				  -	      lsr
   8492  f457				  -	      lsr
   8493  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8494  f457				  -	      txa
   8495  f457				  -			; ...then the X...
   8496  f457				  -	      and	#%00000011
   8497  f457				  -	      tax
   8498  f457				  -	      endif		; !MOUSEXONLY
   8499  f457				  -
   8500  f457				  -	      asl
   8501  f457				  -	      asl
   8502  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodex0
   8503  f457				  -	      tay
   8504  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   8505  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta	; carry was clear by previous ASL
   8506  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8507  f457				  -	      stx	mousecodex0
   8508  f457				  -mouse0loopcondition
   8509  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   8510  f457				  -	      bpl	mouse0updateloop
   8511  f457				  -
   8512  f457				  -			; *** adapt to selected device resolution.
   8513  f457				  -	      ldx	port0control
   8514  f457				  -
   8515  f457				  -	      ifconst	PRECISIONMOUSING
   8516  f457				  -	      ldy	port0resolution
   8517  f457				  -	      bne	mouse0halveddone
   8518  f457				  -	      cpx	#6	; half-resolution is no good for driving wheels
   8519  f457				  -	      beq	mouse0halveddone
   8520  f457				  -			; resolution=0 is half mouse resolution, necessary for precision
   8521  f457				  -			; mousing on a 160x240 screen with a 1000 dpi mouse.
   8522  f457				  -
   8523  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   8524  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8525  f457				  -	      ror		; do a signed divide by 2.
   8526  f457				  -	      clc
   8527  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8528  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8529  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8530  f457				  -	      lda	mouseydelta
   8531  f457				  -	      clc
   8532  f457				  -	      adc	mousey0
   8533  f457				  -	      sta	mousey0
   8534  f457				  -	      endif
   8535  f457				  -			; at half resolution we just exit after updating x and y
   8536  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8537  f457				  -mouse0halveddone
   8538  f457				  -	      endif		; PRECISIONMOUSING
   8539  f457				  -
   8540  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8541  f457				  -	      asl	mouseydelta	; *2 because Y resolution is finer
   8542  f457				  -	      ldy	port0resolution
   8543  f457				  -	      dey
   8544  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8545  f457				  -mousey0resolutionfix
   8546  f457				  -	      clc
   8547  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   8548  f457				  -	      dey
   8549  f457				  -	      bpl	mousey0resolutionfix
   8550  f457				  -	      clc
   8551  f457				  -	      adc	mousey0
   8552  f457				  -	      sta	mousey0
   8553  f457				  -	      endif		; MOUSEXONLY
   8554  f457				  -
   8555  f457				  -	      ldy	port0resolution
   8556  f457				  -	      dey
   8557  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8558  f457				  -mousex0resolutionfix
   8559  f457				  -	      clc
   8560  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta
   8561  f457				  -	      dey
   8562  f457				  -	      bpl	mousex0resolutionfix
   8563  f457				  -	      ifnconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   8564  f457				  -	      clc
   8565  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8566  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8567  f457				  -	      else
   8568  f457				  -	      cpx	#6
   8569  f457				  -	      beq	carryonmouse0boost
   8570  f457				  -	      clc
   8571  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8572  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8573  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8574  f457				  -carryonmouse0boost
   8575  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8576  f457				  -	      clc
   8577  f457				  -	      adc	mousecodey0
   8578  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8579  f457				  -	      clc
   8580  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8581  f457				  -	      tay		; save the target X
   8582  f457				  -	      adc	mousey0	; average in the smoothly-trailing X
   8583  f457				  -	      ror
   8584  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0	; mousex0 now has the smoothly trailing X
   8585  f457				  -	      sty	mousey0	; and mousey0 has the the target X
   8586  f457				  -
   8587  f457				  -			; check to see if the coordinate wrapped. If so, undo the averaging code.
   8588  f457				  -			; A has mousex0, the smoothly trailing X
   8589  f457				  -	      sbc	mousey0	; less the target X
   8590  f457				  -	      bpl	skipabsolutedrive0
   8591  f457				  -	      eor	#$ff
   8592  f457				  -skipabsolutedrive0
   8593  f457				  -	      cmp	#64	; just an unreasonably large change
   8594  f457				  -	      bcc	skipdrivewrapfix0
   8595  f457				  -	      sty	mousex0	; if X wrapped, we catch the trailing X up to the target X
   8596  f457				  -skipdrivewrapfix0
   8597  f457				  -
   8598  f457				  -			; get rid of the tweening if the distance travelled was very small
   8599  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   8600  f457				  -	      cmp	port0resolution
   8601  f457				  -	      bcs	skipbetweenfix0
   8602  f457				  -	      lda	mousex0
   8603  f457				  -	      sta	mousey0
   8604  f457				  -skipbetweenfix0
   8605  f457				  -
   8606  f457				  -drivingboostreductioncheck0
   8607  f457				  -			; The below code amounts to mousecodey0=mousecodey0-(mousecodey0/8)
   8608  f457				  -			; +ve mousecodey0 is converted to -ve to do the calculation, and then
   8609  f457				  -			; negated again because truncation during BCD math results in
   8610  f457				  -			; differing magnitudes, depending if the value is +ve or -ve.
   8611  f457				  -driving0fix
   8612  f457				  -	      lax	mousecodey0
   8613  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8614  f457				  -	      bcs	driving0skipnegate1
   8615  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   8616  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   8617  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8618  f457				  -driving0skipnegate1
   8619  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8620  f457				  -	      ror
   8621  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8622  f457				  -	      ror
   8623  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8624  f457				  -	      ror
   8625  f457				  -	      sta	inttemp1
   8626  f457				  -	      lda	mousecodey0
   8627  f457				  -	      sec
   8628  f457				  -	      sbc	inttemp1
   8629  f457				  -	      cpx	#$80
   8630  f457				  -	      bcs	driving0skipnegate2
   8631  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   8632  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   8633  f457				  -driving0skipnegate2
   8634  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8635  f457				  -drivingboostdone0
   8636  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   8637  f457				  -
   8638  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8639  f457				  -
   8640  f457					      endif		; MOUSE0SUPPORT
   8641  f457
   8642  f457				   mouse1update
   8643  f457				  -	      ifconst	MOUSE1SUPPORT
   8644  f457				  -
   8645  f457				  -mousetableselect =	inttemp2
   8646  f457				  -mousexdelta =	inttemp3
   8647  f457				  -mouseydelta =	inttemp4
   8648  f457				  -lastSWCHA  =	inttemp6
   8649  f457				  -
   8650  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   8651  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   8652  f457				  -
   8653  f457				  -	      lda	#$ff
   8654  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   8655  f457				  -
   8656  f457				  -	      ldy	port1control
   8657  f457				  -
   8658  f457				  -	      lda	#%00010000
   8659  f457				  -	      cpy	#9	; AMIGA?
   8660  f457				  -	      bne	skipamigabitsfix1
   8661  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8662  f457				  -skipamigabitsfix1
   8663  f457				  -	      sta	mousetableselect
   8664  f457				  -	      ifconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   8665  f457				  -	      cpy	#6	; DRIVING?
   8666  f457				  -	      bne	skipdriving1setup
   8667  f457				  -			; swap mousex1 and mousey1. mousex seen by the 7800basic program
   8668  f457				  -			; trails the actual mousex1, so we can smoothly interpolate toward
   8669  f457				  -			; the actual position. This actual position is stored in mousey1
   8670  f457				  -			; after the driver has run.
   8671  f457				  -	      ldx	mousex1
   8672  f457				  -	      lda	mousey1
   8673  f457				  -	      stx	mousey1
   8674  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   8675  f457				  -skipdriving1setup
   8676  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   8677  f457				  -
   8678  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8679  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8680  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   8681  f457				  -
   8682  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSETIME
   8683  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8684  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   8685  f457				  -	      else
   8686  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   8687  f457				  -	      endif
   8688  f457				  -	      else
   8689  f457				  -	      lda	#MOUSETIME
   8690  f457				  -	      endif
   8691  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   8692  f457				  -
   8693  f457				  -mouse1updateloop
   8694  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8695  f457				  -	      and	#%00001111
   8696  f457				  -	      cmp	lastSWCHA
   8697  f457				  -	      beq	mouse1loopcondition
   8698  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   8699  f457				  -
   8700  f457				  -	      ora	mousetableselect	; atari/amiga decoding table selection
   8701  f457				  -
   8702  f457				  -			; st mice encode on different bits/joystick-lines than amiga mice...
   8703  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   8704  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   8705  f457				  -			; ...so can shuffle the amiga bits to reuse the st driver.
   8706  f457				  -	      tay
   8707  f457				  -	      lax	amigatoataribits,y
   8708  f457				  -
   8709  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8710  f457				  -			; first the Y...
   8711  f457				  -	      and	#%00001100
   8712  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodey1
   8713  f457				  -	      tay
   8714  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   8715  f457				  -	      clc
   8716  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   8717  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   8718  f457				  -	      tya
   8719  f457				  -	      lsr
   8720  f457				  -	      lsr
   8721  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   8722  f457				  -	      txa
   8723  f457				  -			; ...then the X...
   8724  f457				  -	      and	#%00000011
   8725  f457				  -	      tax
   8726  f457				  -	      endif		; !MOUSEXONLY
   8727  f457				  -
   8728  f457				  -	      asl
   8729  f457				  -	      asl
   8730  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodex1
   8731  f457				  -	      tay
   8732  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   8733  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta	; carry was clear by previous ASL
   8734  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8735  f457				  -	      stx	mousecodex1
   8736  f457				  -mouse1loopcondition
   8737  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   8738  f457				  -	      bpl	mouse1updateloop
   8739  f457				  -
   8740  f457				  -			; *** adapt to selected device resolution.
   8741  f457				  -	      ldx	port1control
   8742  f457				  -
   8743  f457				  -	      ifconst	PRECISIONMOUSING
   8744  f457				  -	      ldy	port1resolution
   8745  f457				  -	      bne	mouse1halveddone
   8746  f457				  -	      cpx	#6	; half-resolution is no good for driving wheels
   8747  f457				  -	      beq	mouse1halveddone
   8748  f457				  -			; resolution=0 is half mouse resolution, necessary for precision
   8749  f457				  -			; mousing on a 160x240 screen with a 1000 dpi mouse.
   8750  f457				  -
   8751  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   8752  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8753  f457				  -	      ror		; do a signed divide by 2.
   8754  f457				  -	      clc
   8755  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   8756  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   8757  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8758  f457				  -	      lda	mouseydelta
   8759  f457				  -	      clc
   8760  f457				  -	      adc	mousey1
   8761  f457				  -	      sta	mousey1
   8762  f457				  -	      endif
   8763  f457				  -			; at half resolution we just exit after updating x and y
   8764  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET1
   8765  f457				  -mouse1halveddone
   8766  f457				  -	      endif		; PRECISIONMOUSING
   8767  f457				  -
   8768  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8769  f457				  -	      asl	mouseydelta	; *2 because Y resolution is finer
   8770  f457				  -	      ldy	port1resolution
   8771  f457				  -	      dey
   8772  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8773  f457				  -mousey1resolutionfix
   8774  f457				  -	      clc
   8775  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   8776  f457				  -	      dey
   8777  f457				  -	      bpl	mousey1resolutionfix
   8778  f457				  -	      clc
   8779  f457				  -	      adc	mousey1
   8780  f457				  -	      sta	mousey1
   8781  f457				  -	      endif		; MOUSEXONLY
   8782  f457				  -
   8783  f457				  -	      ldy	port1resolution
   8784  f457				  -	      dey
   8785  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8786  f457				  -mousex1resolutionfix
   8787  f457				  -	      clc
   8788  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta
   8789  f457				  -	      dey
   8790  f457				  -	      bpl	mousex1resolutionfix
   8791  f457				  -	      ifnconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   8792  f457				  -	      clc
   8793  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   8794  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   8795  f457				  -	      else
   8796  f457				  -	      cpx	#6
   8797  f457				  -	      beq	carryonmouse1boost
   8798  f457				  -	      clc
   8799  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   8800  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   8801  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET1
   8802  f457				  -carryonmouse1boost
   8803  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8804  f457				  -	      clc
   8805  f457				  -	      adc	mousecodey1
   8806  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   8807  f457				  -	      clc
   8808  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   8809  f457				  -	      tay		; save the target X
   8810  f457				  -	      adc	mousey1	; average in the smoothly-trailing X
   8811  f457				  -	      ror
   8812  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1	; mousex0 now has the smoothly trailing X
   8813  f457				  -	      sty	mousey1	; and mousey0 has the the target X
   8814  f457				  -
   8815  f457				  -			; check to see if the coordinate wrapped. If so, undo the averaging code.
   8816  f457				  -			; A has mousex1, the smoothly trailing X
   8817  f457				  -	      sbc	mousey1	; less the target X
   8818  f457				  -	      bpl	skipabsolutedrive1
   8819  f457				  -	      eor	#$ff
   8820  f457				  -skipabsolutedrive1
   8821  f457				  -	      cmp	#64	; just an unreasonably large change
   8822  f457				  -	      bcc	skipdrivewrapfix1
   8823  f457				  -	      sty	mousex1	; if X wrapped, we catch the trailing X up to the target X
   8824  f457				  -skipdrivewrapfix1
   8825  f457				  -
   8826  f457				  -			; get rid of the tweening if the distance travelled was very small
   8827  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   8828  f457				  -	      cmp	port1resolution
   8829  f457				  -	      bcs	skipbetweenfix1
   8830  f457				  -	      lda	mousex1
   8831  f457				  -	      sta	mousey1
   8832  f457				  -skipbetweenfix1
   8833  f457				  -
   8834  f457				  -drivingboostreductioncheck1
   8835  f457				  -			; The below code amounts to mousecodey0=mousecodey0-(mousecodey0/8)
   8836  f457				  -			; +ve mousecodey0 is converted to -ve to do the calculation, and then
   8837  f457				  -			; negated again because truncation during BCD math results in
   8838  f457				  -			; differing magnitudes, depending if the value is +ve or -ve.
   8839  f457				  -driving1fix
   8840  f457				  -	      lax	mousecodey1
   8841  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8842  f457				  -	      bcs	driving0skipnegate1
   8843  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   8844  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   8845  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   8846  f457				  -driving0skipnegate1
   8847  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8848  f457				  -	      ror
   8849  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8850  f457				  -	      ror
   8851  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8852  f457				  -	      ror
   8853  f457				  -	      sta	inttemp1
   8854  f457				  -	      lda	mousecodey1
   8855  f457				  -	      sec
   8856  f457				  -	      sbc	inttemp1
   8857  f457				  -	      cpx	#$80
   8858  f457				  -	      bcs	driving1skipnegate2
   8859  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   8860  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   8861  f457				  -driving1skipnegate2
   8862  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   8863  f457				  -drivingboostdone1
   8864  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   8865  f457				  -
   8866  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET1
   8867  f457				  -
   8868  f457					      endif		; MOUSE1SUPPORT
   8869  f457
   8870  f457
   8871  f457				   trakball0update
   8872  f457				  -	      ifconst	TRAKBALL0SUPPORT
   8873  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKTIME
   8874  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8875  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   8876  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKXONLY
   8877  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   8878  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   8879  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKTIME
   8880  f457				  -	      lda	#TRAKTIME
   8881  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKTIME
   8882  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   8883  f457				  -	      ldx	#0
   8884  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8885  f457				  -	      ldy	#0
   8886  f457				  -	      endif		; TRAKXONLY
   8887  f457				  -trakball0updateloop
   8888  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8889  f457				  -	      and	#%00110000
   8890  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodex0
   8891  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodex0
   8892  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0movementXdone
   8893  f457				  -	      and	#%00010000
   8894  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0negativeX
   8895  f457				  -trakball0positiveX
   8896  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   8897  f457				  -	      inx		; 2
   8898  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball0movementXdone	; 3
   8899  f457				  -trakball0negativeX
   8900  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   8901  f457				  -	      dex		; 2
   8902  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   8903  f457				  -trakball0movementXdone
   8904  f457				  -
   8905  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8906  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8907  f457				  -	      and	#%11000000
   8908  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodey0
   8909  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodey0
   8910  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0movementYdone
   8911  f457				  -	      and	#%01000000
   8912  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0negativeY
   8913  f457				  -trakball0positiveY
   8914  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   8915  f457				  -	      iny		; 2
   8916  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball0movementYdone	; 3
   8917  f457				  -trakball0negativeY
   8918  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   8919  f457				  -	      dey		; 2
   8920  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   8921  f457				  -trakball0movementYdone
   8922  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   8923  f457				  -
   8924  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   8925  f457				  -	      bpl	trakball0updateloop
   8926  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8927  f457				  -	      cpx	#0
   8928  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0skipXadjust
   8929  f457				  -	      clc
   8930  f457				  -trakball0Xloop
   8931  f457				  -	      adc	port0resolution
   8932  f457				  -	      dex
   8933  f457				  -	      bne	trakball0Xloop
   8934  f457				  -	      clc
   8935  f457				  -	      adc	trakballx0
   8936  f457				  -	      sta	trakballx0
   8937  f457				  -trakball0skipXadjust
   8938  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8939  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8940  f457				  -	      cpy	#0
   8941  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0skipYadjust
   8942  f457				  -	      clc
   8943  f457				  -trakball0yloop
   8944  f457				  -	      adc	port0resolution
   8945  f457				  -	      dey
   8946  f457				  -	      bne	trakball0yloop
   8947  f457				  -	      clc
   8948  f457				  -	      adc	trakbally0
   8949  f457				  -	      sta	trakbally0
   8950  f457				  -trakball0skipYadjust
   8951  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   8952  f457				  -
   8953  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8954  f457					      endif
   8955  f457
   8956  f457
   8957  f457
   8958  f457				   trakball1update
   8959  f457				  -	      ifconst	TRAKBALL1SUPPORT
   8960  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKTIME
   8961  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8962  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   8963  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKXONLY
   8964  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   8965  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   8966  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKTIME
   8967  f457				  -	      lda	#TRAKTIME
   8968  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKTIME
   8969  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   8970  f457				  -	      ldx	#0
   8971  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8972  f457				  -	      ldy	#0
   8973  f457				  -	      endif		; TRAKXONLY
   8974  f457				  -trakball1updateloop
   8975  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8976  f457				  -	      and	#%00000011
   8977  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodex1
   8978  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodex1
   8979  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1movementXdone
   8980  f457				  -	      and	#%00000001
   8981  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1negativeX
   8982  f457				  -trakball1positiveX
   8983  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   8984  f457				  -	      inx		; 2
   8985  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball1movementXdone	; 3
   8986  f457				  -trakball1negativeX
   8987  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   8988  f457				  -	      dex		; 2
   8989  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   8990  f457				  -trakball1movementXdone
   8991  f457				  -
   8992  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   8993  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8994  f457				  -	      and	#%00001100
   8995  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodey1
   8996  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodey1

   8999  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1negativeY
   9000  f457				  -trakball1positiveY
   9001  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)

   9004  f457				  -trakball1negativeY

   9007  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   9008  f457				  -trakball1movementYdone
   9009  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   9010  f457				  -
   9011  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   9012  f457				  -	      bpl	trakball1updateloop
   9013  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9014  f457				  -	      cpx	#0
   9015  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1skipXadjust

   9043  f457
   9044  f457				   paddleport0update
   9045  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLE0SUPPORT
   9046  f457				  -	      lda	#6
   9047  f457				  -	      sta	VBLANK	; start charging the paddle caps
   9048  f457				  -	      lda	#0	; use PADDLE timing
   9049  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   9050  f457				  -
   9051  f457				  -paddleport0updateloop
   9052  f457				  -	      lda	INPT0
   9053  f457				  -	      bmi	skippaddle0setposition
   9054  f457				  -	      sty	paddleposition0
   9055  f457				  -skippaddle0setposition
   9056  f457				  -	      ifconst	TWOPADDLESUPPORT
   9057  f457				  -	      lda	INPT1
   9058  f457				  -	      bmi	skippaddle1setposition
   9059  f457				  -	      sty	paddleposition1
   9060  f457				  -skippaddle1setposition
   9061  f457				  -	      endif
   9062  f457				  -	      ldy	INTIM
   9063  f457				  -	      cpy	#TIMEOFFSET
   9064  f457				  -	      bcs	paddleport0updateloop
   9065  f457				  -
   9066  f457				  -	      lda	#%10000110
   9067  f457				  -	      sta	VBLANK	; dump paddles to ground... this may not be great for genesis controllers
   9068  f457				  -	      sec
   9069  f457				  -	      lda	paddleposition0
   9070  f457				  -	      sbc	#TIMEOFFSET
   9071  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLESCALEX2
   9072  f457				  -	      asl
   9073  f457				  -	      endif
   9074  f457				  -
   9075  f457				  -	      ifnconst	PADDLESMOOTHINGOFF
   9076  f457				  -	      clc
   9077  f457				  -	      adc	paddleprevious0
   9078  f457				  -	      ror
   9079  f457				  -	      sta	paddleprevious0
   9080  f457				  -	      endif
   9081  f457				  -
   9082  f457				  -	      sta	paddleposition0
   9083  f457				  -
   9084  f457				  -	      ifconst	TWOPADDLESUPPORT
   9085  f457				  -	      sec
   9086  f457				  -	      lda	paddleposition1
   9087  f457				  -	      sbc	#TIMEOFFSET
   9088  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLESCALEX2
   9089  f457				  -	      asl
   9090  f457				  -	      endif
   9091  f457				  -
   9092  f457				  -	      ifnconst	PADDLESMOOTHINGOFF
   9093  f457				  -	      clc
   9094  f457				  -	      adc	paddleprevious1
   9095  f457				  -	      ror
   9096  f457				  -	      sta	paddleprevious1
   9097  f457				  -	      endif
   9098  f457				  -	      sta	paddleposition1
   9099  f457				  -	      endif		; TWOPADDLESUPPORT
   9100  f457				  -
   9101  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   9102  f457					      endif
   9103  f457

   9108  f457				  -

   9164  f457
   9165  f457
   9166  f457				   paddlebuttonhandler		; outside of conditional, for button-handler LUT
   9167  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLESUPPORT
   9168  f457				  -			; x=0|1 for port, rather than paddle #.
   9169  f457				  -			; Only the first paddle button will integrate into "joy0fire" testing. If the
   9170  f457				  -			; game wants to support 2 paddles, up to the game to instead test the
   9171  f457				  -			; joystick right+left directions instead.
   9172  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA	; top of nibble is first paddle button
   9173  f457				  -	      cpx	#0	; port 0?
   9174  f457				  -	      beq	skippaddleport2shift
   9175  f457				  -	      asl		; shift second port to upper nibble
   9176  f457				  -	      asl
   9177  f457				  -	      asl
   9178  f457				  -	      asl
   9179  f457				  -skippaddleport2shift
   9180  f457				  -	      and	#%11000000
   9181  f457				  -	      eor	#%11000000	; invert
   9182  f457				  -	      sta	sINPT1,x
   9183  f457				  -	      jmp	buttonreadloopreturn
   9184  f457					      endif		; PADDLESUPPORT
   9185  f457
   9186  f457				   mousebuttonhandler		; outside of conditional, for button-handler LUT
   9187  f457				  -	      ifconst	MOUSESUPPORT
   9188  f457				  -			; stick the mouse buttons in the correct shadow register...
   9189  f457				  -	      txa
   9190  f457				  -	      asl
   9191  f457				  -	      tay		; y=x*2
   9192  f457				  -	      lda	INPT4,x
   9193  f457				  -	      eor	#%10000000
   9194  f457				  -	      lsr
   9195  f457				  -	      sta	sINPT1,x
   9196  f457				  -
   9197  f457				  -	      lda	INPT1,y
   9198  f457				  -	      and	#%10000000
   9199  f457				  -	      eor	#%10000000
   9200  f457				  -	      ora	sINPT1,x
   9201  f457				  -	      sta	sINPT1,x
   9202  f457				  -	      jmp	buttonreadloopreturn
   9203  f457					      endif		; MOUSESUPPORT
   9204  f457
   9205  f457				  -	      ifconst	KEYPADSUPPORT
   9206  f457				  -			; ** select keypad rows 0 to 3 over 4 frames...
   9207  f457				  -keypadrowselect
   9208  f457				  -	      inc	keypadcounter
   9209  f457				  -	      ldy	#0
   9210  f457				  -	      lda	port0control
   9211  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9212  f457				  -	      bne	skipport0val
   9213  f457				  -	      iny		; y=y+1
   9214  f457				  -skipport0val
   9215  f457				  -	      lda	port1control
   9216  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9217  f457				  -	      bne	skipport1val
   9218  f457				  -	      iny
   9219  f457				  -	      iny		; y=y+2
   9220  f457				  -skipport1val
   9221  f457				  -	      cpy	#0
   9222  f457				  -	      beq	exitkeypadrowselect
   9223  f457				  -	      lda	keyrowdirectionmask,y
   9224  f457				  -	      sta	CTLSWA
   9225  f457				  -	      tya
   9226  f457				  -	      asl
   9227  f457				  -	      asl
   9228  f457				  -	      sta	inttemp1
   9229  f457				  -	      lda	keypadcounter
   9230  f457				  -	      and	#3
   9231  f457				  -	      ora	inttemp1
   9232  f457				  -	      tax
   9233  f457				  -	      lda	keyrowselectvalue,x
   9234  f457				  -	      sta	SWCHA
   9235  f457				  -exitkeypadrowselect
   9236  f457				  -	      rts
   9237  f457				  -
   9238  f457				  -keyrowdirectionmask
   9239  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00000000	; 0 : port0=input port1=input
   9240  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11110000	; 1 : port0=output port1=input
   9241  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00001111	; 2 : port0=input port1=output
   9242  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11111111	; 3 : port0=output port1=output
   9243  f457				  -
   9244  f457				  -keyrowselectvalue
   9245  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00000000, #%00000000, #%00000000, #%00000000	; no row selected, all pins high, always
   9246  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11100000, #%11010000, #%10110000, #%01110000	; p0 keypad in
   9247  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00001110, #%00001101, #%00001011, #%00000111	; p1 keypad in
   9248  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11101110, #%11011101, #%10111011, #%01110111	; p0+p1 keypads in
   9249  f457					      endif		; KEYPADSUPPORT
   9250  f457
   9251  f457				  -	      ifconst	KEYPADSUPPORT
   9252  f457				  -			; TODO - split into compile-time KEYPAD0SUPPORT and KEYPAD1SUPPORT
   9253  f457				  -keypadcolumnread
   9254  f457				  -	      lda	port0control
   9255  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9256  f457				  -	      bne	skipkeypadcolumnread0
   9257  f457				  -	      lda	keypadcounter
   9258  f457				  -	      and	#3
   9259  f457				  -	      asl		; x2 because keypad variables are interleaved
   9260  f457				  -	      tax
   9261  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9262  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9263  f457				  -	      lda	INPT0
   9264  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9265  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9266  f457				  -	      lda	INPT1
   9267  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9268  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9269  f457				  -	      lda	INPT4
   9270  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9271  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9272  f457				  -	      lda	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9273  f457				  -	      eor	#%00000111
   9274  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9275  f457				  -skipkeypadcolumnread0
   9276  f457				  -
   9277  f457				  -	      lda	port1control
   9278  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9279  f457				  -	      bne	skipkeypadcolumnread1
   9280  f457				  -	      lda	keypadcounter
   9281  f457				  -	      and	#3
   9282  f457				  -	      asl		; x2 because keypad variables are interleaved
   9283  f457				  -	      tax
   9284  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9285  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9286  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9287  f457				  -	      lda	INPT2
   9288  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9289  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9290  f457				  -	      lda	INPT3
   9291  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9292  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9293  f457				  -	      lda	INPT5
   9294  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9295  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9296  f457				  -	      lda	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9297  f457				  -	      eor	#%00000111
   9298  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9299  f457				  -skipkeypadcolumnread1
   9300  f457				  -	      rts
   9301  f457					      endif		; KEYPADSUPPORT
   9302  f457
   9303  f457				   setportforinput
   9304  f457		       ad 81 02 	      lda	CTLSWA
   9305  f45a		       3d c2 f1 	      and	SWCHA_DIRMASK,x
   9306  f45d		       8d 81 02 	      sta	CTLSWA
   9307  f460		       60		      rts
   9308  f461
   9309  f461				   setonebuttonmode
   9310  f461		       a9 06		      lda	#6	; in case we're in unlocked-bios mode
   9311  f463		       85 01		      sta	VBLANK	; if we were on paddles, the line is grounded out.
   9312  f465		       a9 14		      lda	#$14
   9313  f467		       8d 83 02 	      sta	CTLSWB
   9314  f46a		       ad 82 02 	      lda	SWCHB
   9315  f46d		       1d 87 f4 	      ora	thisjoy2buttonbit,x	; disable: write 1 to the 2-button bit
   9316  f470		       8d 82 02 	      sta	SWCHB
   9317  f473		       60		      rts
   9318  f474
   9319  f474				   settwobuttonmode
   9320  f474		       a9 06		      lda	#6	; in case we're in unlocked-bios mode
   9321  f476		       85 01		      sta	VBLANK	; if we were on paddles, the line is grounded out.
   9322  f478		       a9 14		      lda	#$14
   9323  f47a		       8d 83 02 	      sta	CTLSWB
   9324  f47d		       ad 82 02 	      lda	SWCHB
   9325  f480		       3d 88 f4 	      and	thisjoy2buttonbit+1,x	; enable: write 0 to the 2-button bit
   9326  f483		       8d 82 02 	      sta	SWCHB
   9327  f486		       60		      rts
   9328  f487
   9329  f487				   thisjoy2buttonbit
   9330  f487							; p0	p1   p0
   9331  f487		       04 10 04 	      .byte.b	$04, $10, $04
   9332  f48a
   9333  f48a				  -	      ifconst	CHANGEDMAHOLES
   9334  f48a				  -removedmaholes
   9335  f48a				  -	      ldx	#0
   9336  f48a				  -removedllholesloop
   9337  f48a				  -	      lda	DLLMEM,x
   9338  f48a				  -	      and	#%10001111
   9339  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM,x
   9340  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9341  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM+DBOFFSET,x
   9342  f48a				  -	      endif
   9343  f48a				  -	      inx
   9344  f48a				  -	      inx
   9345  f48a				  -	      inx
   9346  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9347  f48a				  -	      cpx	#DBOFFSET
   9348  f48a				  -	      bcc	removedllholesloop
   9349  f48a				  -	      else
   9350  f48a				  -	      bpl	removedllholesloop
   9351  f48a				  -	      endif
   9352  f48a				  -	      rts
   9353  f48a				  -
   9354  f48a				  -createdmaholes
   9355  f48a				  -	      ldx	#0
   9356  f48a				  -createdllholesloop
   9357  f48a				  -	      lda	DLLMEM,x
   9358  f48a				  -	      ora	#(WZONEHEIGHT*4)
   9359  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM,x
   9360  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9361  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM+DBOFFSET,x
   9362  f48a				  -	      endif
   9363  f48a				  -	      inx
   9364  f48a				  -	      inx
   9365  f48a				  -	      inx
   9366  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9367  f48a				  -	      cpx	#DBOFFSET
   9368  f48a				  -	      bcc	createdllholesloop
   9369  f48a				  -	      else
   9370  f48a				  -	      bpl	createdllholesloop
   9371  f48a				  -	      endif
   9372  f48a				  -	      rts
   9373  f48a					      endif
   9374  f48a
   9375  f48a							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
   9376  f48a
   9377  f48a				   START
   9378  f48a				   start
   9379  f48a
   9380  f48a							;******** more or less the Atari recommended startup procedure
   9381  f48a
   9382  f48a		       78		      sei
   9383  f48b		       d8		      cld
   9384  f48c
   9385  f48c					      ifnconst	NOTIALOCK
   9386  f48c		       a9 07		      lda	#$07
   9387  f48e				  -	      else
   9388  f48e				  -	      lda	#$06
   9389  f48e					      endif
   9390  f48e		       85 01		      sta	INPTCTRL	;lock 7800 into 7800 mode
   9391  f490		       a9 7f		      lda	#$7F
   9392  f492		       85 3c		      sta	CTRL	;disable DMA
   9393  f494		       a9 00		      lda	#$00
   9394  f496		       85 38		      sta	OFFSET
   9395  f498					      ifnconst	NOTIALOCK
   9396  f498		       85 01		      sta	INPTCTRL
   9397  f49a		       85 20		      sta	BACKGRND	; black default, in case a flash cart is using something else
   9398  f49c					      endif
   9399  f49c		       a2 ff		      ldx	#$FF
   9400  f49e		       9a		      txs
   9401  f49f
   9402  f49f							;************** Clear Memory
   9403  f49f
   9404  f49f							; ** Clear 1800-27FF, pg0+pg1 memory.
   9405  f49f				   ClearMemPages
   9406  f49f		       a9 00		      lda	#0
   9407  f4a1		       a8		      tay		; y=0
   9408  f4a2		       85 80		      sta	$80
   9409  f4a4		       a2 18		      ldx	#$18
   9410  f4a6				   ClearMemPagesLoop
   9411  f4a6		       86 81		      stx	$81	; needed for when we step on ZP memory
   9412  f4a8		       91 80		      sta	($80),y	;Store data
   9413  f4aa		       c8		      iny		;Next byte
   9414  f4ab		       d0 f9		      bne	ClearMemPagesLoop
   9415  f4ad		       e8		      inx
   9416  f4ae		       e0 28		      cpx	#$28
   9417  f4b0		       d0 f4		      bne	ClearMemPagesLoop
   9418  f4b2		       85 81		      sta	$81
   9419  f4b4
   9420  f4b4							;seed random number with hopefully-random timer value
   9421  f4b4		       a9 01		      lda	#1
   9422  f4b6		       0d 84 02 	      ora	INTIM
   9423  f4b9		       85 40		      sta	rand
   9424  f4bb
   9425  f4bb							; detect the console type...
   9426  f4bb				   pndetectvblankstart
   9427  f4bb		       a5 28		      lda	MSTAT
   9428  f4bd		       10 fc		      bpl	pndetectvblankstart	; if we're not in VBLANK, wait for it to start
   9429  f4bf				   pndetectvblankover
   9430  f4bf		       a5 28		      lda	MSTAT
   9431  f4c1		       30 fc		      bmi	pndetectvblankover	; then wait for it to be over
   9432  f4c3		       a0 00		      ldy	#$00
   9433  f4c5		       a2 00		      ldx	#$00
   9434  f4c7				   pndetectvblankhappening
   9435  f4c7		       a5 28		      lda	MSTAT
   9436  f4c9		       30 07		      bmi	pndetectinvblank	; if VBLANK starts, exit our counting loop
   9437  f4cb		       85 24		      sta	WSYNC
   9438  f4cd		       85 24		      sta	WSYNC
   9439  f4cf		       e8		      inx
   9440  f4d0		       d0 f5		      bne	pndetectvblankhappening
   9441  f4d2				   pndetectinvblank
   9442  f4d2		       e0 7d		      cpx	#125
   9443  f4d4		       90 02		      bcc	pndetecispal
   9444  f4d6		       a0 01		      ldy	#$01
   9445  f4d8				   pndetecispal
   9446  f4d8		       8c 09 21 	      sty	paldetected
   9447  f4db
   9448  f4db		       20 eb f3 	      jsr	createallgamedlls
   9449  f4de
   9450  f4de		       a9 18		      lda	#>DLLMEM
   9451  f4e0		       85 2c		      sta	DPPH
   9452  f4e2		       a9 00		      lda	#<DLLMEM
   9453  f4e4		       85 30		      sta	DPPL
   9454  f4e6
   9455  f4e6				  -	      ifconst	pokeysupport
   9456  f4e6				  -			; pokey support is compiled in, so try to detect it...
   9457  f4e6				  -	      jsr	detectpokeylocation
   9458  f4e6					      endif
   9459  f4e6
   9460  f4e6		       a9 01		      lda	#1	; default for port 0 and 1 is a regular joystick
   9461  f4e8		       8d b8 01 	      sta	port0control
   9462  f4eb		       8d b9 01 	      sta	port1control
   9463  f4ee
   9464  f4ee							;Setup port A to read mode
   9465  f4ee							;lda #$00
   9466  f4ee							;sta SWCHA
   9467  f4ee							;sta CTLSWA
   9468  f4ee
   9469  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	HSSUPPORT
   9470  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	bankswitchmode
   9471  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	included.hiscore.asm.bank
   9472  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MCPDEVCART
   9473  f4ee				  -	      lda	#($18 | included.hiscore.asm.bank)
   9474  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9475  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9476  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9477  f4ee				  -	      sta	$3000
   9478  f4ee				  -	      else
   9479  f4ee				  -	      lda	#(included.hiscore.asm.bank)
   9480  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9481  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9482  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9483  f4ee				  -	      sta	$8000
   9484  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9485  f4ee				  -	      endif		; included.hiscore.asm.bank
   9486  f4ee				  -	      endif		; bankswitchmode
   9487  f4ee				  -			; try to detect HSC
   9488  f4ee				  -	      jsr	detecthsc
   9489  f4ee				  -	      and	#1
   9490  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsdevice
   9491  f4ee				  -skipHSCdetect
   9492  f4ee				  -			; try to detect AtariVox eeprom
   9493  f4ee				  -	      jsr	detectatarivoxeeprom
   9494  f4ee				  -	      and	#2
   9495  f4ee				  -	      ora	hsdevice
   9496  f4ee				  -	      cmp	#3
   9497  f4ee				  -	      bne	storeAinhsdevice
   9498  f4ee				  -			; For now, we tie break by giving HSC priority over AtariVox.
   9499  f4ee				  -			; Later we should check each device's priority byte if set, instead,
   9500  f4ee				  -	      lda	#2
   9501  f4ee				  -storeAinhsdevice
   9502  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsdevice
   9503  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$ff
   9504  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsdifficulty
   9505  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsgameslot
   9506  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsnewscoreline
   9507  f4ee					      endif		; HSSUPPORT
   9508  f4ee
   9509  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	AVOXVOICE
   9510  f4ee				  -	      jsr	silenceavoxvoice
   9511  f4ee					      endif
   9512  f4ee
   9513  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MULTIBUTTON
   9514  f4ee				  -	      ifnconst	HSSUPPORT
   9515  f4ee				  -min_detectatarivoxeeprom
   9516  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_startwrite
   9517  f4ee				  -	      bcc	min_no_eeprom_error
   9518  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$ff
   9519  f4ee				  -	      jmp	min_avoxdetect_done
   9520  f4ee				  -min_no_eeprom_error
   9521  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$30
   9522  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_txbyte
   9523  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$00
   9524  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_txbyte
   9525  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_stopwrite
   9526  f4ee				  -min_avoxdetect_done
   9527  f4ee				  -	      eor	#$FF
   9528  f4ee				  -	      sta	avoxdetected
   9529  f4ee				  -	      jmp	min_detectatarivoxeepromdone
   9530  f4ee				  -	      include	"i2c7800.inc"
   9531  f4ee				  -	      I2C_SUBS	temp9
   9532  f4ee				  -min_detectatarivoxeepromdone
   9533  f4ee				  -	      endif		; HSSUPPORT
   9534  f4ee					      endif		; MULTIBUTTON
   9535  f4ee
   9536  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MULTIBUTTON
   9537  f4ee				  -	      lda	avoxdetected
   9538  f4ee				  -	      beq	skipassignavox
   9539  f4ee				  -	      lda	#10
   9540  f4ee				  -	      sta	port1control	; designate port 1 as atarivox so multibutton won't disturb it.
   9541  f4ee				  -skipassignavox
   9542  f4ee					      endif		; MULTIBUTTON
   9543  f4ee
   9544  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	RMT
   9545  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	RMTVOLUME
   9546  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$F0	; default to full RMT volume
   9547  f4ee				  -	      sta	rmtvolume
   9548  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	TIAVOLUME
   9549  f4ee				  -	      sta	tiavolume
   9550  f4ee				  -	      endif		; TIAVOLUME
   9551  f4ee				  -	      endif		; RMTVOLUME
   9552  f4ee					      else		; !RMT
   9553  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	TIAVOLUME
   9554  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$F0	; default to full TIA volume
   9555  f4ee				  -	      sta	tiavolume
   9556  f4ee					      endif		; TIAVOLUME
   9557  f4ee					      endif		; RMT
   9558  f4ee
   9559  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	bankswitchmode
   9560  f4ee				  -			; we need to switch to the first bank as a default. this needs to
   9561  f4ee				  -			; happen before DMA, in case there's a topscreenroutine in bank 0
   9562  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MCPDEVCART
   9563  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$18	; xxx11nnn - switch to bank 0
   9564  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9565  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9566  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9567  f4ee				  -	      sta	$3000
   9568  f4ee				  -	      else
   9569  f4ee				  -	      lda	#0
   9570  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9571  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9572  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9573  f4ee				  -	      sta	$8000
   9574  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9575  f4ee					      endif
   9576  f4ee
   9577  f4ee							; CTRL 76543210
   9578  f4ee							; 7 colorburst kill
   9579  f4ee							; 6,5 dma ctrl 2=normal DMA, 3=no DMA
   9580  f4ee							; 4 character width 1=2 byte chars, 0=1 byte chars
   9581  f4ee							; 3 border control 0=background color border, 1=black border
   9582  f4ee							; 2 kangaroo mode 0=transparency, 1=kangaroo
   9583  f4ee							; 1,0 read mode 0=160x2/160x4 1=N/A 2=320B/320D 3=320A/320C
   9584  f4ee
   9585  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEWIDE
   9586  f4ee				  -	      lda	#%01010000	;Enable DMA, mode=160x2/160x4, 2x character width
   9587  f4ee					      else
   9588  f4ee		       a9 40		      lda	#%01000000	;Enable DMA, mode=160x2/160x4
   9589  f4f0					      endif
   9590  f4f0
   9591  f4f0		       20 4e f4 	      jsr	waitforvblankstart	; give the some vblank time to minimally update the display
   9592  f4f3
   9593  f4f3		       85 3c		      sta	CTRL
   9594  f4f5		       8d 07 21 	      sta	sCTRL
   9595  f4f8
   9596  f4f8		       20 de f3 	      jsr	vblankresync
   9597  f4fb
   9598  f4fb		       a2 01		      ldx	#1
   9599  f4fd		       20 74 f4 	      jsr	settwobuttonmode
   9600  f500		       a2 00		      ldx	#0
   9601  f502		       20 74 f4 	      jsr	settwobuttonmode
   9602  f505
   9603  f505					      ifnconst	.altgamestart
   9604  f505		       4c 00 80 	      jmp	game
   9605  f508				  -	      else
   9606  f508				  -	      jmp	.altgamestart
   9607  f508					      endif
   9608  f508
   9609  f508							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
   9610  f508
   9611  f508							; A tunable parameter, to claim some memory back from DL usage
   9612  f508		       00 00	   MEMSKIP    =	$00
   9613  f508
   9614  f508							;************** Setup DLL entries
   9615  f508
   9616  f508							; setup some working definitions, to avoid ifnconst mess elsewhere...
   9617  f508					      ifnconst	SCREENHEIGHT
   9618  f508		       00 c0	   WSCREENHEIGHT =	192
   9619  f508				  -	      else
   9620  f508				  -WSCREENHEIGHT =	SCREENHEIGHT
   9621  f508					      endif
   9622  f508
   9623  f508				  -	      ifnconst	ZONEHEIGHT
   9624  f508				  -WZONEHEIGHT =	16
   9625  f508					      else
   9626  f508		       00 10	   WZONEHEIGHT =	ZONEHEIGHT
   9627  f508					      endif
   9628  f508
   9629  f508					      ifnconst	ZONECOUNT
   9630  f508				  -	      ifconst	VSCROLL
   9631  f508				  -WZONECOUNT =	((WSCREENHEIGHT/WZONEHEIGHT)+1)
   9632  f508					      else		; !VSCROLL
   9633  f508		       00 0c	   WZONECOUNT =	(WSCREENHEIGHT/WZONEHEIGHT)
   9634  f508					      endif		; !VSCROLL
   9635  f508				  -	      else
   9636  f508				  -	      ifconst	VSCROLL
   9637  f508				  -WZONECOUNT =	(ZONECOUNT+1)
   9638  f508				  -	      else		; !VSCROLL
   9639  f508				  -WZONECOUNT =	ZONECOUNT
   9640  f508				  -	      endif		; !VSCROLL
   9641  f508					      endif
   9642  f508
   9643  f508							; top of the frame, non-visible lines. this is based on NTSC,
   9644  f508							; but we add in extra NV lines at the end of the display to ensure
   9645  f508							; our PAL friends can play the game without it crashing.
   9646  f508		       00 19	   NVLINES    =	((243-WSCREENHEIGHT)/2)
   9647  f508
   9648  f508					      ifnconst	DLMEMSTART
   9649  f508					      ifnconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9650  f508				   WDLMEMSTART SET	$1880
   9651  f508				  -	      else
   9652  f508				  -WDLMEMSTART SET	$18E0
   9653  f508					      endif		; DOUBLEBUFFER
   9654  f508				  -	      else
   9655  f508				  -WDLMEMSTART SET	DLMEMSTART
   9656  f508					      endif
   9657  f508
   9658  f508				  -	      if	MEMSKIP > 0
   9659  f508				  -	      echo	"   ",[WDLMEMSTART],"to",[WDLMEMSTART+MEMSKIP-1],"was freed for game usage with MEMSKIP."
   9660  f508				  -WDLMEMSTART SET	(WDLMEMSTART + MEMSKIP)
   9661  f508					      endif		; MEMSKIP > 0
   9662  f508
   9663  f508					      ifnconst	DLMEMEND
   9664  f508				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
   9665  f508				  -WDLMEMEND  =	$23FF
   9666  f508					      else
   9667  f508		       1f ff	   WDLMEMEND  =	$1FFF
   9668  f508					      endif
   9669  f508				  -	      else
   9670  f508				  -WDLMEMEND  =	DLMEMEND
   9671  f508					      endif
   9672  f508
   9673  f508
   9674  f508				   WMEMSIZE   SET	(WDLMEMEND-WDLMEMSTART+1)
   9675  f508
   9676  f508				  -	      ifconst	VSCROLL
   9677  f508				  -	      ifnconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9678  f508				  -			; give the last zone extra ram for the dma mask objects...
   9679  f508				  -WMEMSIZE   SET	(WMEMSIZE-(maskscrollspriteend-maskscrollsprite))
   9680  f508				  -	      endif		; DOUBLEBUFFER
   9681  f508					      endif		; VSCROLL
   9682  f508
   9683  f508					      ifnconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9684  f508		       00 9b	   DLLASTOBJ  =	((((WMEMSIZE/WZONECOUNT)-2)/5)*5)	; -2 to always ensure we have 1x double-byte terminator
   9685  f508				  -	      else
   9686  f508				  -DLLASTOBJ  =	((((WMEMSIZE/WZONECOUNT)-4)/10)*5)	; -4 to always ensure we have 2x double-byte terminators
   9687  f508					      endif
   9688  f508
   9689  f508		       00 9d	   TDOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET =	(DLLASTOBJ+2)	; offset between DL buffers. ie. half the real DL
   9690  f508				  -	      if	TDOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET > 255
   9691  f508				  -DOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET =	255
   9692  f508					      else
   9693  f508		       00 9d	   DOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET =	(DLLASTOBJ+2)
   9694  f508					      endif
   9695  f508
   9696  f508				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
   9697  f508				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	$2300
   9698  f508					      endif
   9699  f508
   9700  f508				   DLPOINTH
   9701  f508				   DLINDEX    SET	0
   9702  f508					      REPEAT	WZONECOUNT
   9703  f508				   TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(((DLINDEX*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART)
   9704  f508				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
   9705  f508				  -	      if	TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
   9706  f508				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
   9707  f508				  -	      else
   9708  f508				  -	      if	((((DLINDEX+1)*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART) > $1FFF
   9709  f508				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
   9710  f508				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	TMPMEMADDRESS
   9711  f508				  -	      endif
   9712  f508				  -	      endif		; TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
   9713  f508					      endif		; EXTRADLMEMORY
   9714  f508							;echo " "," ZONE",[DLINDEX]d,"ADDRESS: ",TMPMEMADDRESS
   9715  f508		       18		      .byte.b	>TMPMEMADDRESS

   9769  f52c							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
   9770  f52c
   9771  f52c							; a simple guard, than ensures the 7800basic code hasn't
   9772  f52c							; spilled into the encryption area...
     2642 bytes left in the 7800basic reserved area.
   9773  f52c					      echo	"   ",($FF7E-*)d,"bytes left in the 7800basic reserved area."
   9774  f52c				  -	      if	(*>$FF7D)
   9775  f52c				  -	      echo
   9776  f52c				  -	      echo	"***************************"
   9777  f52c				  -	      echo	"*** Abort: ROM Overflow ***"
   9778  f52c				  -	      echo	"***************************"
   9779  f52c				  -	      ERR		; abort the assembly
   9780  f52c					      endif
   9781  f52c
   9782  f52c							; throw a compile
   9783  f52c				  -	      ifconst	RMT
   9784  f52c				  -	      ifnconst	pokeysupport
   9785  f52c				  -	      echo
   9786  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
   9787  f52c				  -	      echo	"*** ABORT: RMT Tracker requires 'set pokeysupport $xxxx' ***"
   9788  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
   9789  f52c				  -	      ERR		; abort
   9790  f52c				  -	      endif		; pokeysupport
   9791  f52c				  -	      ifnconst	pokeyaddress
   9792  f52c				  -	      echo
   9793  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
   9794  f52c				  -	      echo	"*** ABORT: RMT Tracker requires 'set pokeysupport $xxxx' ***"
   9795  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
   9796  f52c				  -	      ERR		; abort
   9797  f52c				  -	      endif		; pokeyaddress
   9798  f52c					      endif

   9801  f52c
   9802  f52c				  -	      ifconst	DEV
   9803  f52c				  -	      ifnconst	ZONEHEIGHT
   9804  f52c				  -	      echo	"* the 4k 7800basic area has",[($FF7E - *)]d,"bytes free."
   9805  f52c				  -	      else
   9806  f52c				  -	      if	ZONEHEIGHT = 8
   9807  f52c				  -	      echo	"* the 4k 7800basic area has",[($FF7E - *)]d,"bytes free."
   9808  f52c				  -	      else

   9810  f52c				  -	      endif
   9811  f52c				  -	      endif
   9812  f52c					      endif

   9815  f52c				  -	      .byte	0
   9816  f52c					      endif
   9817  f52c				   START_OF_ROM SET	0
   9818  f52c
   9819  f52c							; FF7E/FF7F contains the 7800basic crc checksum word
   9820  f52c
   9821  f52c							; FF80 - FFF7 contains the 7800 encryption key
   9822  f52c
   9823  f52c					      ifnconst	bankswitchmode
   9824  fff8					      ORG	$FFF8
   9825  fff8				  -	      else
   9826  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM128K
   9827  fff8				  -	      ORG	$27FF8
   9828  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
   9829  fff8				  -	      endif
   9830  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM144K
   9831  fff8				  -	      ORG	$27FF8
   9832  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
   9833  fff8				  -	      endif
   9834  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM256K
   9835  fff8				  -	      ORG	$47FF8
   9836  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
   9837  fff8				  -	      endif
   9838  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM272K
   9839  fff8				  -	      ORG	$47FF8
   9840  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
   9841  fff8				  -	      endif
   9842  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM512K
   9843  fff8				  -	      ORG	$87FF8
   9844  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
   9845  fff8				  -	      endif
   9846  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM528K
   9847  fff8				  -	      ORG	$87FF8
   9848  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
   9849  fff8				  -	      endif
   9850  fff8					      endif
   9851  fff8
   9852  fff8
   9853  fff8		       ff		      .byte.b	$FF	; region verification. $FF=all regions
   9854  fff9		       f7		      .byte.b	$F7	; high nibble:  encryption check from $N000 to $FF7F. we only hash the last 4k for faster boot.
   9855  fffa							; low nibble :  N=7 atari rainbow start, N=3 no atari rainbow
   9856  fffa
   9857  fffa							;Vectors
   9858  fffa		       00 f0		      .word.w	NMI
   9859  fffc		       8a f4		      .word.w	START
   9860  fffe		       5f f0		      .word.w	IRQ
   9861  10000
